rationale: The paper offers an actionable architecture for dynamic alpha weighting with explicit PPO controls and useful ablations. However, possible leakage in alpha-generation workflow, limited evaluation breadth, and weak statistical validation materially reduce confidence for production deployment.
rejection_reasons: Reject immediate autonomous production use due to unresolved leakage risk in alpha generation relative to train/test boundaries.
Reject production promotion without walk-forward, multi-regime validation on a broader asset universe.
Reject high-stakes deployment without stronger statistical evidence (confidence intervals/significance) against stronger adaptive baselines.
Reject direct execution rollout without realistic market microstructure cost modeling.
recommendations: Implement as a deterministic internal research module for adaptive alpha weighting.
Enforce train-only alpha generation and immutable data/split manifests.
Run walk-forward evaluation with expanded universes and multiple regimes.
Add significance testing and confidence intervals for all headline metrics.
Integrate realistic execution-cost simulation before any live-trading consideration.
follow_up_actions: Reproduce Table 7 with fixed seeds and explicit artifact manifests (data hash, code hash, config hash).
Quantify contribution of regime filter and volatility scaling independent of PPO weighting.
Benchmark against stronger adaptive non-RL methods (for example rolling-IC weighting and ridge-based blending).
Run slippage/spread/impact sensitivity tests by market and liquidity bucket.
